summary: Melvin McNair was a Delta Airlines hijacker in Algiers. According to a CIA cable from October 2, 1972, McNair provided information regarding William Holder's role in the Black Panther Party (BPP) and the strained relationship between Eldridge Cleaver and other BPP members. Other documents mention American Black militants/hijackers moving from Algeria to France and Switzerland, desiring to return to the U.S. for revolutionary activities, and potentially receiving Algerian government-provided travel documents. Another document mentions Black Panther members arriving in Paris from Algiers and receiving support from Henri Curiel's organization to obtain plastic surgery and false documentation for re-entry into the U.S.
significance: The documents do not explicitly link Melvin McNair to the JFK assassination. His significance lies in his involvement with the Black Panther Party, his hijacking activities, and his connections to other individuals and organizations involved in militant activities and support networks for those seeking to evade authorities.
